overview_of_class: Linguistics 460 continues the development of students' analytical skills in syntax and sentence processing studies, and examines in detail the assumptions, goals and results of syntactic studies and syntactic parsing studies. This course covers the foundational matters in the study of syntax namely formalist and functionalist approaches. Specifically, we discuss how island constraints are analyzed from the formalist and the functionalist perspectives and, see what the difference between the two approaches is and what the motivations behind the two approaches are.
name: Syntactic Analysis I
subject: LING
